item.text: King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon came against Jerusalem with his whole army and laid siege to it. The siege began in the tenth month of the ninth year that Zedekiah ruled over Judah.

It lasted until the <st data-num="08672" class="">ninth</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">day</st> of the <st data-num="07243" class="">fourth</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> of <st data-num="06667" class="">Zedekiah’s</st> <st data-num="06249 06240">eleventh</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st>.<n id="1" /> On that day they <st data-num="01234" class="">broke through</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> walls.

Then <st data-num="05371" class="">Nergal Sharezer</st> of Samgar, <st data-num="05562" class="">Nebo</st> <st data-num="08310" class="">Sarsekim</st> (who was a <st data-num="07249" class="">chief officer</st>), <st data-num="05371" class="">Nergal Sharezer</st> (who was a <st data-num="07248" class="">high official</st>),<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="07611" class="">other</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">officers</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> and <st data-num="03427" class="">set up quarters</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="08432" class="">Middle</st> <st data-num="08179" class="">Gate</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="01961 0834">When</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="06667" class="">Zedekiah</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="0582 04421">soldiers</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> them, they tried to <st data-num="01272" class="">escape</st>. They <st data-num="03318" class="">departed</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> during the <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st>. They took a <st data-num="01870" class="">path</st> through the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="01588" class="">garden</st> and passed out through the <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the two <st data-num="02346" class="">walls</st>.<n id="1" /> Then they <st data-num="03318" class="">headed</st> <st data-num="01870" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="06160" class="">rift valley</st>.<n id="2" />

But the <st data-num="03778" class="">Babylonian</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st> <st data-num="07291" class="">chased</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them. They <st data-num="05381" class="">caught up with</st> <st data-num="06667" class="">Zedekiah</st> in the <st data-num="06160" class="">plains</st> of <st data-num="03405" class="">Jericho</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03947" class="">captured</st> him.<n id="3" /> They <st data-num="05927" class="">took</st> him <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="05019" class="">Nebuchadnezzar</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> at <st data-num="07247" class="">Riblah</st><n id="4" /> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">territory</st> of <st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st>, and Nebuchadnezzar <st data-num="01696" class="">passed</st> <st data-num="04941" class="">sentence</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">on</st> him there.

There at <st data-num="07247" class="">Riblah</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> had <st data-num="06667" class="">Zedekiah’s</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="07819" class="">put to death</st> while Zedekiah was forced to <st data-num="05869" class="">watch</st>. The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> also had <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="02715" class="">nobles</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="07819" class="">put to death</st>.

Then he had <st data-num="06667" class="">Zedekiah’s</st> <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st> <st data-num="05786" class="">put out</st> and had him <st data-num="0631" class="">bound</st> in <st data-num="05178" class="">chains</st><n id="1" /> to be <st data-num="0935" class="">led off</st> to <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>.
The Babylonians burned down the royal palace, the temple of the Lord, and the people’s homes, and they tore down the wall of Jerusalem.

Then <st data-num="05018" class="">Nebuzaradan</st>, the <st data-num="07227" class="">captain</st> of the royal <st data-num="02876" class="">guard</st>,<n id="1" /> took captive the <st data-num="03499" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> who were <st data-num="07604" class="">left</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>. He <st data-num="01540" class="">carried</st> them <st data-num="01540" class="">off</st> to <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> along with the <st data-num="05307" class="">people</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> had <st data-num="05307" class="">deserted</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> him.<n id="2" />
But he left behind in the land of Judah some of the poor people who owned nothing. He gave them fields and vineyards at that time.
Now King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon had issued orders concerning Jeremiah. He had passed them on through Nebuzaradan, the captain of his royal guard,

“<st data-num="03947" class="">Find</st> Jeremiah<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="05869 07760">look out</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> him.<n id="2" /> Do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> <st data-num="03972" class="">anything</st> to <st data-num="07451" class="">harm</st> him,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03588 0518">but</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> him <st data-num="0834 03651">whatever</st> he <st data-num="01696 0413">tells</st> you.”

So <st data-num="05018" class="">Nebuzaradan</st> (the <st data-num="07227" class="">captain</st> of the royal <st data-num="02876" class="">guard</st>), <st data-num="05021" class="">Nebushazban</st> (who was a <st data-num="07249" class="">chief officer</st>), <st data-num="05371" class="">Nergal Sharezer</st> (who was a <st data-num="07248" class="">high official</st>),<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the other <st data-num="07227" class="">officers</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>

sent and had Jeremiah brought from the courtyard of the guardhouse. They turned him over to Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam and the grandson of Shaphan, to take him home with him. But Jeremiah stayed among the people.
Now the Lord’s message had come to Jeremiah while he was still confined in the courtyard of the guardhouse,

“Go and tell Ebed Melech the Nubian, ‘This is what the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, the God of Israel, has said, “I will carry out against this city what I promised. It will mean disaster and not good fortune for it. When that disaster happens, you will be there to see it.
But I will rescue you when it happens. I, the Lord, affirm it! You will not be handed over to those whom you fear.
I will certainly save you. You will not fall victim to violence. You will escape with your life because you trust in me. I, the Lord, affirm it!”’”
